awards.description:
DESCRIPTION:THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS GAP PROJECT INCLUDE: 1.ADVANCE GAP ADMINISTRATIVE PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT TO IMPROVE EFFICIENCY AND EFFECTIVENESS OF PROGRAMMATIC WORK; 2. CONDUCT COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL OUTREACH AND EDUCATION ON GAP PROGRAM ACTIVITIES TO ENCOURAGE UNDERSTANDING AND PARTICIPATION; 3. SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PLANNING AND PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT; AND 4. EXPAND AND IMPROVE ON SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE IMPLEMENTATION PRACTICES AND PROCESSES. RESEARCH THE LATEST TECHNOLOGIES IN SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT TO IDENTIFY THE BEST WAYS TO RECYCLE AND CUT DOWN ON DEBRIS BUILD UP TO PROMOTE A HEALTHIER ENVIRONMENT.
 ACTIVITIES:COMPONENT 1: REVIEW AND UPDATE ADMINISTRATIVE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES NOT REVIEWED IN THE PREVIOUS GRANT; REVIEW/UPDATE AS NEEDED THE EPA - TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PLAN WITH THE EPA PROJECT OFFICER AND COUNCIL AT LEAST ANNUALLY; ATTEND THE ALASKA TRIBAL CONFERENCE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGEMENT, AND THE ALASKA FORUM ON THE ENVIRONMENT, AND THE DECEMBER GAP WORKSHOP.
COMPONENT 2: CONDUCT QUARTERLY COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL MEETINGS; PUBLISH A MONTHLY ENVIRONMENTAL NEWSLETTER/ONLINE POSTINGS; CONDUCT A COMMUNITY CLEANUP AS AN EDUCATIONAL EVENT, FOCUSING ON BEST RECYCLING AND LANDFILL PRACTICES; COLLABORATE WITH OTHER ORGANIZATIONS TO GET TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND TO EXPLORE EMERGING ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES; SUPPORT THE COMMUNITY-BASED ADVISORY GROUP ESTABLISHED IN FY22 TO ASSIST WITH PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROGRAM.
COMPONENT 3: COLLABORATE WITH A VARIETY OF TRIBAL, CONSORTIA, GOVERNMENTAL, AND NON-GOVERNMENTAL PARTNERS TO DEVELOP AND EXPAND SUSTAINABLE SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE STRATEGIES; DEVELOP WASTE MANAGEMENT CODES AND ORDINANCES; HOLD A COMMUNITY ENVIRONMENTAL MEETING TO DISCUSS THE INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN AND THE LONG TERM PLANS FOR STEVENS VILLAGE'S SOLID/HAZARDOUS WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM. ESTABLISH MECHANISMS TO ASSURE A FINANCIALLY SUSTAINABLE WASTE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM.
COMPONENT 4: APPLY THE PRINCIPLES AND PROCESSES IN THE INTEGRATED WASTE MANAGEMENT PLAN TO THE CURRENT PRACTICES, FACILITIES, AND ISSUES IN THE COMMUNITY; PARTICIPATE IN RURAL ALASKA LANDFILL OPERATOR TRAINING OR REFRESHER; HIRE AN EQUIPMENT OPERATOR TO CLEAN LANDFILL AREA (COVER, FILL, AND CONTAINMENT OF WASTE); IMPLEMENT SUSTAINABLE MATERIALS MANAGEMENT STRATEGIES; AND COLLECT AND STAGE ITEMS/MATERIALS IN THE DESIGNATED AREA FOR BACKHAUL. CONDUCT BACKHAUL WHEN ENOUGH MATERIALS HAVE BEEN STAGED.
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES: COPIES OF QUARTERLY REPORTS, TRIP REPORTS, PRESENTATIONS, MEETING NOTES, ATTENDANCE LISTS, PHOTOS.

OUTCOMES: 
BUILDING ADMINISTRATIVE GRANTS MANAGEMENT CAPACITY WILL ESTABLISH A SUSTAINABLE PROGRAM THAT WILL ADDRESS LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES FOR A HEALTHIER COMMUNITY
HAVING A WELL-INFORMED AND SUPPORTIVE COMMUNITY WILL IMPROVE HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH IN STEVENS VILLAGE.
STAFF, COUNCIL, AND COMMUNITY UNDERSTANDING OF SOLID WASTE ISSUES, THEIR CONSEQUENCES, AND THE NEED FOR NEW ACTIONS WILL PROMOTE ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP.
IMPLEMENTING THE PRACTICES AND PROCESSES ESTABLISHED IN THE IWMP WILL RESULT IN AN EFFICIENTLY MANAGED LANDFILL THAT WILL MINIMIZE WASTE AND IMPROVE HUMAN AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH IN STEVENS VILLAGE.
 
BENEFICIARIES: THE COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ENVIRONMENT OF STEVENS VILLAGE.

PROJECT TITLE: NATIVE VILLAGE OF STEVENS TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM FUNDING FY 2024 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ALL TRANSPORTATION FUNDING PROVIDED BY FHWA TO NATIVE VILLAGE OF STEVENS  UNDER THE FHWA OTT PROGRAM AGREEMENT FOR FY24

PROJECT TITLE: NATIVE VILLAGE OF STEVENS TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM FUNDING FY 2025 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ALL TRANSPORTATION FUNDING PROVIDED BY FHWA TO NATIVE VILLAGE OF STEVENS UNDER THE FHWA OTT PROGRAM AGREEMENT FOR FY25

PROJECT TITLE: NATIVE VILLAGE OF STEVENS TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM FUNDING FY 2025 :::: PROJECT DESCRIPTION: ALL TRANSPORTATION FUNDING PROVIDED BY FHWA TO NATIVE VILLAGE OF STEVENS UNDER THE FHWA OTT PROGRAM AGREEMENT FOR FY25
